sheep.collision
Class Shape

java.lang.Object
  sheep.collision.Shape
Direct Known Subclasses:
Polygon
public abstract class Shape
extends java.lang.Object

An abstraction over all shapes in the collision detection system. Users can subclass this and create custom shapes if necessary. In principle, Shapes do not have a position. They represent location independent geometry, and their position at any given time is determined by the current parent Sprite. The collision detection method follows the principle of the template pattern. Some steps are fixed and some are abstract.

Constructor Detail

Shape

public Shape()
Method Detail

collides

public boolean collides(Shape shape)
The high level collision detection function. It gets the axes from each of the shapes and check for separation on each one.

Parameters:
shape - The other Shape which may or may not collide with this Shape.
Returns:
True on collision, false otherwise.

separates

public boolean separates(Shape shape,
                         Vector2 axis)
Checks for separation between two shapes along a certain axis.

Parameters:
shape - The other Shape to check with this Shape.
axis - The axis which is to be tested.
Returns:
True if separate along the axis, false otherwise.

getAxes

public abstract Vector2[] getAxes()
Gets the axes for this Shape.

Returns:
A vector of all the axes for the Shape.

project

public abstract Interval project(Vector2 axis)
Projects this Shape onto the axis.

Parameters:
axis - The axis to project this Shape onto.
Returns:
The resulting Interval along the axis.

getBoundingBox

public abstract BoundingBox getBoundingBox()
Gets the BoundingBox of the Shape. This is used in particular during spatial partitioning to determine in which quadrant the Shape should be inserted.

Returns:
The BoundingBox of the Shape.

update

public abstract void update(float dt,
                            android.graphics.Matrix matrix)
Updates the Shape according to the parent's transformation matrix. This can also be used to animate the Shape.

Parameters:
dt - The timestep since last frame (in seconds).
matrix - The transformation matrix of the parent Sprite.
